thread.title: Katie Rough’s funeral service will see family and friends pay emotional farewell to the murdered schoolgirl
thread.title_full: Katie Rough’s funeral service will see family and friends pay emotional farewell to the murdered schoolgirl

author: ecambridge
title: Katie Rough’s funeral service will see family and friends pay emotional farewell to the murdered schoolgirl
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments FAMILY and friends gathered together today at York Minster to say goodbye to Katie Rough – a seven-year-old girl who was killed last month. 
She was found with “severe lacerations to her neck and chest” on a playing field in York near to her home, and died later in hospital. PA:Press Association Paul and Alison Rough (centre), parents of murdered York schoolgirl Katie Rough, arrive at York Minster with the Archbishop of York Dr John Sentamu PA:Press Association The funeral cortege for seven-year-old Katie Rough arriving at York Minster this afternoon SWNS:South West News Service Katie’s death shook the city of York after she was attacked in the Woodthorpe area on January 9 
Her funeral at the Minster was led by the Archbishop of York, Dr John Sentamu. 
Those attending were asked by Katie’s parents, Paul and Alison, to dress formally but with a colourful twist. 
They said in a statement ahead of the service: “We are asking as many people as possible to attend and to wear traditional funeral outfits but to add a splash of colour such as a rainbow tie, red shoes, bright hair piece, etc., – whatever you feel comfortable in.” 
Katie’s death shook the city of York after she was attacked in the Woodthorpe area on January 9. 
More than 1,300 people donated money to an online appeal for her family which raised more than £25,000. 
Her parents have thanked all those who have raised money and said a lasting memorial will be established for their daughter. 
They said: “It has helped us more than you can ever imagine.” 
The funeral service was in the Quire at York Minster with additional seating in the cathedral’s Nave. RELATED STORIES Dad's heartbreak at having to formally identify body of murdered seven-year-old daughter Katie Rough 'LIFE WILL NEVER BE THE SAME' Katie Rough farewelled after being fatally stabbed - what do we know about tragic schoolgirl? 'LIFE WILL NEVER BE THE SAME' Katie Rough's mum shares photo of tattoo tribute to her tragic seven-year-old daughter KATIE 'KILLER' BACK IN COURT Katie Rough murder accused, 15, remains silent during five-minute court hearing HAPPY BIRTHDAY KATIE Parents of murdered schoolgirl Katie Rough pictured for first time as family release hundreds of balloons for her eighth birthday special tribute Family of murdered Katie Rough to release 200 balloons to mark her eighth birthday 
At the end of the service, the procession left through the South Transept Door as the family went to a private family service of committal. 
This weekend Katie’s family released a poignant video tribute to her which included heartbreaking messages and pictures of the young girl. 
Since her death, Katie’s distraught mother has said “life will never be the same” after changing her Facebook profile photo to two wrists with tattooed tributes to her daughter. SWNS:South West News Service She was found with “severe lacerations to her neck and chest” on a playing field in York near to her home, and died later in hospital SWNS:South West News Service 5 Katie’s parents previously held a memorial on what would have been her eighth birthday, where they let go of coloured balloons 
In one of the tattoos, a Dr Seuss-inspired message reads: “Today you are You, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is youer than you”. 
In another heartbreaking message, Alison wrote on social media: “My beautiful beautiful sassy, kind, amazing girl. 
“I love her more than any words could even come close to explaining. Life will never ever be the same again. 
“My children, my grandson and my husband are my whole entire life, I live only for them. #teamrough .” 
Katie’s parents also held a memorial on what would have been her eighth birthday, where they let go of coloured balloons. 
A 15-year-old girl, who cannot be named, has appeared in court charged with Katie’s murder. She is due to appear at Leeds Crown Court again on Thursday.
